an6.66:4.1: “Mendicants, without giving up six things you can’t realize perfection.
an6.66:4.3: Dullness, drowsiness, restlessness, remorse, lack of faith, and negligence.
an6.66:4.4: Without giving up these six qualities you can’t realize perfection.
an6.66:5.1: After giving up six things you can realize perfection.
an6.66:5.3: Dullness, drowsiness, restlessness, remorse, lack of faith, and negligence.
an6.66:5.4: After giving up these six things you can realize the fruit of perfection.”
